blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: A Lifetime Of Happiness
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2OyKZEp

by PinkEasterEggs

Tony’s just got engaged to Pepper after a brief spiral back into his past bad habits, following the events of Siberia. His life is just getting back on track when a vaguely familiar face of flings-past comes to give him some news.

He’s going to be a father.

Words: 2267, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe, The Avengers (Marvel Movies)
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Characters: Tony Stark, Pepper Potts, James “Rhodey” Rhodes, Happy Hogan, Mary Parker
  • Relationships: Peter Parker & Tony Stark, Pepper Potts/Tony Stark
  • Additional Tags: Peter Parker is Tony Stark’s Biological Child, Captain America: Civil War (Movie) Compliant, Engagement, Angst, Baby Peter Parker


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2OyKZEp

title: Just a Small Injury
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2OyKREV

by brbbella

summary: I heard Captain Marvel has pro-military propaganda
title: I heard Captain Marvel has pro-military propaganda
body:
[[Warning! Spoilers ahead!]]

I watched the film today and… didn’t see any? If anything, it had more of an anti-military message, being a story about a soldier overcoming her brainwashing and realising her superiors and government were corrupt and lying about the reasons for the war she participated in.

Sure, the US military appears in the film, but more as a setting and location than anything else. It was completely tangential and had no real bearing on the plot, except for the (minor) conspiracy that covered up Carol’s “death” (which doesn’t look pro-military to me. “There was a mistake that cost us billions over dollars, so we’re gonna pretend it never happened” doesn’t sound like something that makes you look good). Sure, most of the characters were either current or former soldiers, but that’s all the characters, good or bad.

I just fail to see any justification for that criticism. It sounded like a perfectly valid one until I actually watched the film and didn’t see any basis for it. Especially since I didn’t hear any such criticisms levied against Captain America (although, admittedly, I wasn’t paying much attention to the MCU when that film came out), despite it being a much more pro-military film. The film is about a soldier learning the truth about what they’re fighting for and turning on those who lied to them. How is that pro-military? That it’s showing soldiers as people with their own lives? People who can grow? That’s just a movie treating soldiers as characters, rather than mooks for the heroes and villains to go through.

[[Warning! Spoilers ahead!]]

I watched the film today and… didn’t see any? If anything, it had more of an anti-military message, being a story about a soldier overcoming her brainwashing and realising her superiors and government were corrupt and lying about the reasons for the war she participated in.

Sure, the US military appears in the film, but more as a setting and location than anything else. It was completely tangential and had no real bearing on the plot, except for the (minor) conspiracy that covered up Carol’s “death” (which doesn’t look pro-military to me. “There was a mistake that cost us billions over dollars, so we’re gonna pretend it never happened” doesn’t sound like something that makes you look good). Sure, most of the characters were either current or former soldiers, but that’s all the characters, good or bad.

I just fail to see any justification for that criticism. It sounded like a perfectly valid one until I actually watched the film and didn’t see any basis for it. Especially since I didn’t hear any such criticisms levied against Captain America (although, admittedly, I wasn’t paying much attention to the MCU when that film came out), despite it being a much more pro-military film. The film is about a soldier learning the truth about what they’re fighting for and turning on those who lied to them. How is that pro-military? That it’s showing soldiers as people with their own lives? People who can grow? That’s just a movie treating soldiers as characters, rather than mooks for the heroes and villains to go through.

blog.name: id-savemysoul
blog.title: The quickest shipper in the wild West

summary: Starker. First declaration of love. Daddy!Tony
body:
Starker. First declaration of love. Daddy!Tony

Peter doesn’t know how to tell Tony about his feels and he decided to ask Tony.

Peter: hey Mr Stark can I …

Tony:

Peter: ugh…Mr Tony?

Tony:

Peter: …Tony? *confuses*

Tony: *grins, negative nods*

Peter: *VERY confused* d-daddy? *blushes*

Tony: YEEAAH sweetie-boy *moving closer* of course u can do all u want *closer* ALL what do u want

Peter: *very confused blushing baby*

Tony: what do u want, baby? *Cuddles*

Peter: I - I want to ask you

Tony: yes kid?

Peter: ur help, plz

Tony: what kind of help?

Peter: I’m full in love with someone and I don’t know how to say about it

Tony: *angry daddy* Mmm… Why I should help u with it, mm? Who is he? Or *gasp* she?!

Peter: *look down* why r u angry with me? Are u jealous, daddy? *Sits down on Tony’s knees*

This somebody is Tony Stark, u know him?

Tony: *shocked* yes? So, just be a good boy and say about ur feels more often, ur Tony will be so enjoy, babe *smile, hugs Peter*

Peter: u think so? *Smile* maybe you’ll help me with something else?

Tony: yes?

Peter: I need kiss practice, promptly, for my daddy *Approaching Tony’s face*

Tony: of course, babe, I’ll help u

Peter: I love you~

Tony: I love you too, baby *kissing Parker*

blog.name: stevehesaidabadlanguageword
blog.title: Higher Further Faster
blog.description: 29. Marvel obsessed side blog of @piensa-bonito. Trying my hand at this fanfic thing. Masterlist

summary: Watching Avengers 1, and look what I noticed! Every time I rewatch a movie I see something I hadn’t before. And I think about...
body: Watching Avengers 1, and look what I noticed! Every time I rewatch a movie I see something I hadn’t before. And I think about how much thought has gone into the past 10+ years to connect all these story lines. This is why I love Marvel!

reblog.comment: Watching Avengers 1, and look what I noticed! Every time I rewatch a movie I see something I hadn’t before. And I think about how much thought has gone into the past 10+ years to connect all these story lines. This is why I love Marvel!

blog.name: scavengingforwords
blog.title:
Fandom!
(largely Marvel Fandom)
blog.description: I'm a nerd who gets sucked into tons of fandoms, here is where I will gather my fandom love. Let’s be honest though, at this point this is like 99.99% Marvel and of that percentage 99% of it is Avengers Academy related.

summary:
Peter: hey mr. starlord, how old were you when you found out santa wasn’t real?
Quill whispering to Gamora: how old am...
body:
Peter: hey mr. starlord, how old were you when you found out santa wasn’t real?

Quill whispering to Gamora: how old am i?

Gamora: you’re 34, peter



Quill with tears in his eyes: i was 34

title: Love In The Ink 8/18
body:
Pairing: Tattoo Artist! Steve Rogers x Reader  **Soul Mate AU**

Warnings: Language. Doubts. Arguments. Adult relationship struggles.

Every tattoo you get, appears on the skin on your soul mate and vice versa. Two souls connected, their connection written in the stars. But what if you question the way soul mates work? What the hell a soul mate even is? But when you get a new tattoo done, by the gorgeous artist Steve. You get a life altering surprise as well. He’s your soul mate. How do you struggle to understand being connected and understand what you’re feeling? Will you manage to figure it out or will you end up pushing Steve away with your conspiracy theory ways?

Your date with Steve ended in a hug and walk to your car. It was stiff and awkward, you felt so much pressure for it to be more, that you sort of lost train of thought and didn’t know what to talk about. You shift your camera bag on your shoulder, slipping up your sunglasses on your head, you step into the shop. It’d been a few days since your date, and you’d come with a mission. Buck stood talking to a woman at the front desk. He smirks when he looks up to find you.

“Hey, back again?” He chuckles.

“He in?” You smile, tipping your head towards the hall.

“Yeah.” He nods, telling you to go ahead. “Just finishing up I think.”

“Thank Bucky.” You wave your fingers as he goes back to the woman in front of him. You stroll down the hall, towards Steve’s work space.

You slip a hand into your back pocket of your high waisted cut off shorts, as you stop in the doorway. Watching Steve, his brow connected in concentration, his shoulders taunt as he works on the guy sitting in his chair. The gun shuts off and Steve straightens up, he looks up finding you. He grins, setting down the tattoo gun on the tray.

“Well aren’t you a surprise.” He chuckles, finishing the rest of what he had to do.

“Yeah,” you smile, stepping into the room, setting your bag on the desk “well I figured I could come bug you at work.” You spin the chair, before straddling it.

“You are more than welcome too.” He chuckles, placing tape on the edges of the plastic covering the tattoo.

“Maybe,” you shrug “if you’re free, you’d want to get ice cream with me.” You smile pretty at him when he looks up again.

“Let me ask, when you work?” He lifts a brow.

“Maybe I’m working now.” You tip your head, smiling at him.

“Is that so?” He nods slowly. There’s a moment where he shakes hands with the guy, but he leaves the room and Steve updates the computer quickly.

“Well I have my camera.” You point to the desk next to the computer.

“Ah huh.” He nods looking from your bag to you. “New assignment?” He asks.

“Sort of, but I’ll need your help.” You admit.

“My help?” He asks, typing away.

“Unless you’re okay with me running off to seedy tattoo shops alone.” You smirk when his head snaps up suddenly.

“You’re not funny.” He gives you a dirty look.

“Explain it over ice cream?” You grin.

“Are you trying to butter me up?” He asks, shutting the computer down.

“No.” You snort standing up. “Or I would have wore something low cut.” You nod. Looking down at your simple, white, form fitting, T-shirt. Steve shakes his head, picking up your camera bag, he ushers you out of the room.

“Alright, let’s check the front before we go.” He leads you down the hall.

“Man, Steve, your shadow got small.” Someone laughs. He’s tall, muscular, lean and has messy, wild brown hair.

“Peter, Y/N.” Steve smiles, coming to a stop in the front lobby.

“Wow, the Y/N.” Peter grins, nodding as he looks you over. You take notice he’s wearing a cut up T-shirt, the side cut deep down, exposing his rib tattoo.

“Love your tattoos.” You grin, lighting up. His forearm is tattooed as well.

“Thanks.” He nods, smiling softly.

“Come on.” Steve takes your hand, leading you from the shop. “You can start explaining this seedy tattoo shops comment.” Steve smirks down at you.

“Awe, but I liked his ink.” You pout a little as you walk down the sidewalk.

“I’ll explain that over ice cream.” He nods, something in his blue eyes grows sad suddenly.



—————————



“You first.” He smirks as she struggles to eat her ice cream and climb into the raised stool of the ice cream shop. Y/N grumbles but manages to get into the seat.

“So there is the opportunity to interview and photograph tattoo artist in our area.” She explains, poking her spoon into her cup of ice cream.

“Really?” He chews slowly wondering where she was going with this.

“Yeah.” She nods. “Well I jumped at it. I want to include you and the shop.” She shrugs. “If you’re okay with that. As well as maybe going with me to a few shops to talk to other artists.” Y/N pops the spoonful of ice cream in her mouth quickly.

“What are you interviewing us about?” He asks, smiling at her.

“Basically being modern day cupids and what that means for you and your idea of soul mates.” She explains, with a small wave of her spoon.

“I think the guys would be okay with that.” He nods. “But you’ll need to ask Peter first.” He chews the inside of his cheek.

“May I ask why?” Her head tips.

“Peter. He met Gwen when they were in high school. Turns out she was his soul mate. She died a year into college. Car accident.” He explains. His chest ached for Peter and his loss. Her face falls, looking sullen at her ice cream cup.

“Oh Peter.” She speaks softly. “Maybe I just won’t put him through that.” She nods once, shrugging.

“But the other guys would be for it.” He tries to change the tone of things.

“Good.” She scoops ice cream on to her spoon. “So tell me how you all know each other?” She smiles.

“I’ve known Bucky, pretty much all my life.” He chuckles.

“Really? How did you meet?” She perks up.

“Playground.” He laughs, pushing his spoon into his ice cream. “I was getting beat up. Bucky came to my rescue with his metal lunch box.” He nods.

“You?” Her brow connects. “Getting beat up?” She blinks confused eyes at him, making him laugh.

“I was a small, small kid. Till junior year of high school.” He explains.

“You? Small? Beat up?” She shakes her head. “Not words I would use in the same sentence.” She snorts.

“Bucky says it took me a while to grow into my strong headedness.” He laughs.

“You strong headed? What? No.” She faux shock.

“Really?” He sighs, looking over at her. “You have so much room to talk?” He lifts a brow.

“So how did you meet the other guys?” She changes the subject quickly. Her head tips as she looks down at her ice cream, her top half ponytail falls over.

“Smooth.” He laughs.

“I know.” She grins, popping another bite of ice cream into her mouth.

“Playground.” He laughs, pushing his spoon into his ice cream. “I was getting beat up. Bucky came to my rescue with his metal lunch box.” He nods.

“You?” Her brow connects. “Getting beat up?” She blinks confused eyes at him, making him laugh.

“I was a small, small kid. Till junior year of high school.” He explains.

“You? Small? Beat up?” She shakes her head. “Not words I would use in the same sentence.” She snorts.

“Bucky says it took me a while to grow into my strong headedness.” He laughs.

“You strong headed? What? No.” She faux shock.

“Really?” He sighs, looking over at her. “You have so much room to talk?” He lifts a brow.

“So how did you meet the other guys?” She changes the subject quickly. Her head tips as she looks down at her ice cream, her top half ponytail falls over.

“Smooth.” He laughs.

“I know.” She grins, popping another bite of ice cream into her mouth.

trail.content:
Pairing: Tattoo Artist! Steve Rogers x Reader  **Soul Mate AU**

Warnings: Language. Doubts. Arguments. Adult relationship struggles.

Every tattoo you get, appears on the skin on your soul mate and vice versa. Two souls connected, their connection written in the stars. But what if you question the way soul mates work? What the hell a soul mate even is? But when you get a new tattoo done, by the gorgeous artist Steve. You get a life altering surprise as well. He’s your soul mate. How do you struggle to understand being connected and understand what you’re feeling? Will you manage to figure it out or will you end up pushing Steve away with your conspiracy theory ways?

Your date with Steve ended in a hug and walk to your car. It was stiff and awkward, you felt so much pressure for it to be more, that you sort of lost train of thought and didn’t know what to talk about. You shift your camera bag on your shoulder, slipping up your sunglasses on your head, you step into the shop. It’d been a few days since your date, and you’d come with a mission. Buck stood talking to a woman at the front desk. He smirks when he looks up to find you.

“Hey, back again?” He chuckles.

“He in?” You smile, tipping your head towards the hall.

“Yeah.” He nods, telling you to go ahead. “Just finishing up I think.”

“Thank Bucky.” You wave your fingers as he goes back to the woman in front of him. You stroll down the hall, towards Steve’s work space.

You slip a hand into your back pocket of your high waisted cut off shorts, as you stop in the doorway. Watching Steve, his brow connected in concentration, his shoulders taunt as he works on the guy sitting in his chair. The gun shuts off and Steve straightens up, he looks up finding you. He grins, setting down the tattoo gun on the tray.

“Well aren’t you a surprise.” He chuckles, finishing the rest of what he had to do.

“Yeah,” you smile, stepping into the room, setting your bag on the desk “well I figured I could come bug you at work.” You spin the chair, before straddling it.

“You are more than welcome too.” He chuckles, placing tape on the edges of the plastic covering the tattoo.

“Maybe,” you shrug “if you’re free, you’d want to get ice cream with me.” You smile pretty at him when he looks up again.

“Let me ask, when you work?” He lifts a brow.

“Maybe I’m working now.” You tip your head, smiling at him.

“Is that so?” He nods slowly. There’s a moment where he shakes hands with the guy, but he leaves the room and Steve updates the computer quickly.

“Well I have my camera.” You point to the desk next to the computer.

“Ah huh.” He nods looking from your bag to you. “New assignment?” He asks.

“Sort of, but I’ll need your help.” You admit.

“My help?” He asks, typing away.

“Unless you’re okay with me running off to seedy tattoo shops alone.” You smirk when his head snaps up suddenly.

“You’re not funny.” He gives you a dirty look.

“Explain it over ice cream?” You grin.

“Are you trying to butter me up?” He asks, shutting the computer down.

“No.” You snort standing up. “Or I would have wore something low cut.” You nod. Looking down at your simple, white, form fitting, T-shirt. Steve shakes his head, picking up your camera bag, he ushers you out of the room.

“Alright, let’s check the front before we go.” He leads you down the hall.

“Man, Steve, your shadow got small.” Someone laughs. He’s tall, muscular, lean and has messy, wild brown hair.

“Peter, Y/N.” Steve smiles, coming to a stop in the front lobby.

“Wow, the Y/N.” Peter grins, nodding as he looks you over. You take notice he’s wearing a cut up T-shirt, the side cut deep down, exposing his rib tattoo.

“Love your tattoos.” You grin, lighting up. His forearm is tattooed as well.

“Thanks.” He nods, smiling softly.

“Come on.” Steve takes your hand, leading you from the shop. “You can start explaining this seedy tattoo shops comment.” Steve smirks down at you.

“Awe, but I liked his ink.” You pout a little as you walk down the sidewalk.

“I’ll explain that over ice cream.” He nods, something in his blue eyes grows sad suddenly.



—————————



“You first.” He smirks as she struggles to eat her ice cream and climb into the raised stool of the ice cream shop. Y/N grumbles but manages to get into the seat.

“So there is the opportunity to interview and photograph tattoo artist in our area.” She explains, poking her spoon into her cup of ice cream.

“Really?” He chews slowly wondering where she was going with this.

“Yeah.” She nods. “Well I jumped at it. I want to include you and the shop.” She shrugs. “If you’re okay with that. As well as maybe going with me to a few shops to talk to other artists.” Y/N pops the spoonful of ice cream in her mouth quickly.

“What are you interviewing us about?” He asks, smiling at her.

“Basically being modern day cupids and what that means for you and your idea of soul mates.” She explains, with a small wave of her spoon.

“I think the guys would be okay with that.” He nods. “But you’ll need to ask Peter first.” He chews the inside of his cheek.

“May I ask why?” Her head tips.

“Peter. He met Gwen when they were in high school. Turns out she was his soul mate. She died a year into college. Car accident.” He explains. His chest ached for Peter and his loss. Her face falls, looking sullen at her ice cream cup.

“Oh Peter.” She speaks softly. “Maybe I just won’t put him through that.” She nods once, shrugging.

“But the other guys would be for it.” He tries to change the tone of things.

“Good.” She scoops ice cream on to her spoon. “So tell me how you all know each other?” She smiles.

“I’ve known Bucky, pretty much all my life.” He chuckles.

“Really? How did you meet?” She perks up.

“Playground.” He laughs, pushing his spoon into his ice cream. “I was getting beat up. Bucky came to my rescue with his metal lunch box.” He nods.

“You?” Her brow connects. “Getting beat up?” She blinks confused eyes at him, making him laugh.

“I was a small, small kid. Till junior year of high school.” He explains.

“You? Small? Beat up?” She shakes her head. “Not words I would use in the same sentence.” She snorts.

“Bucky says it took me a while to grow into my strong headedness.” He laughs.

“You strong headed? What? No.” She faux shock.

“Really?” He sighs, looking over at her. “You have so much room to talk?” He lifts a brow.

“So how did you meet the other guys?” She changes the subject quickly. Her head tips as she looks down at her ice cream, her top half ponytail falls over.

“Smooth.” He laughs.

“I know.” She grins, popping another bite of ice cream into her mouth.

Every tattoo you get, appears on the skin on your soul mate and vice versa. Two souls connected, their connection written in the stars. But what if you question the way soul mates work? What the hell a soul mate even is? But when you get a new tattoo done, by the gorgeous artist Steve. You get a life altering surprise as well. He’s your soul mate.
